metadata.title: CVE-2018-20060 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 20.04 LTS (focal) - low
metadata.description:
urllib3 before version 1.23 does not remove the Authorization HTTP headerwhen following a cross-origin redirect (i.e., a redirect that differs inhost, port, or scheme). This can allow for credentials in the Authorizationheader to be exposed to unintended hosts or transmitted in cleartext.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-20060` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

python-urllib3 - 1.24-1
python3-urllib3 - 1.24-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: python-urllib3 package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.24-1').
